intro: Eremolimon jarmolenkoi, commonly known as the Armenian rockrose, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. It produces pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is occasionally cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
